title: Toa Fepuleai
text:
Gasetoa Fepuleai (known as Toa or Gus Fepuleai) is a New Zealand former <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who represented <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> .
Early years.
Fepuleai was born in <a href="Western%20Samoa">Western Samoa</a> and attended <a href="Seddon%20High%20School">Seddon High School</a> where he played at fullback in the school's <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> first XV.
Playing career.
Fepuleai joined the <a href="Richmond%20Rovers">Richmond</a> <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> club in the <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20League">Auckland Rugby League</a> competition. In 1976 he won the <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20League%20club%20trophies">Tetley Trophy</a> as top try scorer.
He made his <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand national rugby league team</a> debut in 1978, on the wing.
In 1979 Fepuleai played for both <a href="Auckland%20rugby%20league%20team">Auckland</a> and <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> against the touring <a href="Great%20Britain%20Lions">Great Britain Lions</a> side. He was also a part of the Richmond side that won the Auckland premiership in 1979, a title they defended in 1980.
Later years.
Fepuleai later served as the chairman of the <a href="Richmond%20Rovers">Richmond Rovers</a> club.
